title.narrative: Emergency Response to Tropical Cyclone Tomas

description.narrative: On 16 March 2010 the Fiji Interim Government declared a state of natural disaster emergency in the Northern and Eastern Divisions of Fiji affected by Tropical Cyclone Tomas. At its peak, Tropical Cyclone Tomas was a Category 4 cyclone, with winds up to 140 km an hour and gusts up to 200 km an hour. Most parts of the country have been affected by strong winds, rain and heavy seas. Communications to many of these islands have yet to be restored. Fiji’s National Disaster Management Office (NDMO) has advised that there are around 12,500 people sheltering in evacuation centres across Fiji. Funding under this initiative represents Australia's emergency response, specifically Australia will deliver tents, tarpaulins, water storage containers and water purification materials. The total value of Australia's contribution is $1.4 million over 2 years, starting 2009-10.

participating-org.narrative: Australia - Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade
